resources.string: Click on the plus icon to create a conversion card
The card update label displays the last time the conversion price was updated
Click on the delete button of a card to delete that conversion card
The sync button fetches the current conversion price between the cryptocurrency and the base currency

It shows the short code for the cryptocurrency, the currency code for the base currency and also a flag to identify the country that uses that base currency. Like in the image above it displays BTC(Bitcoin) and NGN(Nigerian Naira) with the Nigerian Flag
This displays the price of the cryptocurrency in base currency. Like in the image above, it shows that 1 bitcoin costs 2,601,653,72 Nigerian Naira
To start conversion click on the conversion card. This would be anywhere else besides the buttons
The card created view box displays the date and time in which the conversion card was created
This box displays exactly the same date as that in the previous screen. Only this time it shows it in a more human friendly form

the convert card displays the price of one crypto currency in the corresponding base currency and it has two input fields(one for the cryptocurrency value and the other for the base currency value). The conversion is done in both directions and results are obtained on the go i.e as values change in the field
Performs the same function as the sync button on the conversion card
An icon that represents the cryptocurrency
